text: It was an honor to host the 2025 VAT Summit alongside Speaker Mike Johnson’s office last week. I am especially thankful to @SpeakerJohnson, @SteveScalise, @GOPMajorityWhip, and @RepLisaMcClain for sharing their leadership perspectives, priorities, and how we can continue uniting leaders to strengthen America’s future.

Today we honor Charlie Kirk with a memorial that reflects the life he lived—rooted in faith, love of country, and service to others. His voice challenged us to be bold in what is right and steadfast in our convictions. I pray this service marks the beginning of a spiritual revival across America, turning hearts away from evil and toward the light offered to us by Christ. That would be the legacy Charlie most wanted for us all.
Thank you Charlie!

Today, we will vote on a clean Continuing Resolution to keep the government up and running into November. Democrats had demanded a clean CR and that’s what this is. But now the Democrats have moved the goalposts and don’t want a clean CR.

I was glad to welcome @SecWar Pete Hegseth to the Values Action Team reception on Capitol Hill, where he shared some thoughtful remarks. Afterwards, we spoke about several key priorities: the future of Space Command and getting it up and running in Huntsville, strengthening the defense industrial base in the Shoals area and North Alabama, and restoring common sense at the Department of War by ending policies on abortion travel and DEI that distract from readiness.

Today we learned that an infant was safely surrendered at the new Safe Haven Baby Box at Muscle Shoals Fire Station Four—the first use of this life-saving resource in the city. I’m grateful to the Muscle Shoals first responders and the Kids to Love Foundation, which helped spearhead Baby Boxes across North Alabama, for ensuring this child received immediate care and a path to a loving home. This is exactly why I support Safe Haven initiatives—compassionate, anonymous options that protect life and help parents in crisis.
 https://t.co/V6sL24QhFz

Thank you, @AuburnU, for taking action in removing employees who engaged in and incited hate speech related to the assassination on Charlie Kirk. 

There is no place for those who promote or tolerate violence in our educational institutions. This was absolutely the right decision.

Proud to introduce the Constitution Day resolution alongside @RepBonnie and recognize the importance of the Constitution, both at the time of its signing on September 17, 1787, and the importance it still bears today. 

https://t.co/SgyFoIsLqg

For nearly two and a half centuries, the Constitution has been the guiding framework of our Republic, ensuring freedom, limiting government, and protecting the rights of the people. As we honor Constitution Day, we should recommit ourselves to preserving its principles for future generations.

All 12 appropriations bills have successfully moved out of Committee, a major milestone that reflects the hard work of @HouseGOP. This progress shows our commitment to the America First agenda and ensuring fiscal responsibility while providing the resources needed to keep our nation strong.
https://t.co/zK1W9P9fae

Together, the subcommittee chairs have worked alongside Chairman Cole to ensure that, as appropriators, we remain committed to fiscal responsibility and transparency through regular order. As Chairman of the Labor, Health and Human Services, and Education Subcommittee, I am especially proud of this bill for balancing careful financial stewardship while maintaining key investments in biomedical research, schools, and public health. We can Make America Great Again by making America fiscally responsible again.

Today marks 24 years since the tragic events of September 11, 2001. We honor the innocent lives lost, the bravery of first responders, and the strength of a nation forever changed. 

We will never forget. God bless the fallen and the United States of America. https://t.co/kytq0RVFbw

I am deeply saddened to hear of Charlie Kirk's passing. Charlie was a devoted Christian and father. Because of his faith, I know he is now at peace with the Lord.  Please continue to pray for Charlie's family, his young children, and all of his loved ones.
Please join me in praying for Charlie Kirk, his family, and all of the students that were gathered at the event in Utah.

Thank you President Trump for the invitation to have dinner last night in the beautiful White House Rose Garden with other members of Congress. It was a great evening to not only hear from the President, but also Vice President Vance. https://t.co/M98xLIBSkF

Great to be back in Washington and working to move the appropriations process along. As Chair of the @HouseAppropsGOP Labor, HHS, and Education Committee, I’m focused on reining in spending and shifting away from the status quo that’s fueled chronic health issues, it's time to find real solutions to Make America Healthy Again.

The U.S. Space Command Alabama Family Portrait: It has been a team effort to right this wrong and get Space Command headed back to Alabama and Redstone Arsenal. @RepDaleStrong @SenTuberville @SenKatieBritt @RepBarryMoore @RepMikeRogersAL @USRepGaryPalmer https://t.co/Qra4ytBpcg
https://t.co/lDTFt9fpro

I applaud President Trump’s decision to locate @US_SpaceCom in its rightful place, Huntsville, Alabama. This decision is the result of years of work by the Alabama delegation, and now Space Command will take its place among North Alabama’s world-renowned space, aeronautics, and defense leaders.
The improvement in crime rates in DC is already evident, and it's clear that President Trump's crackdown is working and was badly needed. https://t.co/vWXU2qZgN1

I am deeply saddened by the passing of Dr. James C. Dobson, a true pillar of faith and family values. His unwavering commitment to strengthening families and advancing biblical truths shaped countless lives across our nation. My prayers are with his wife Shirley, their children Danae and Ryan, and the entire family. May we honor his legacy by continuing the work he devoted his life to.

I commend President Trump for the work he continues to do to try and resolve conflicts in the world. He is using American leadership and strength as leverage to end conflict and to stop the killing of innocent people. It’s so good to have leadership back in the White House.

I appreciate President Trump acknowledging the crime problems in DC, and taking decisive action. Many of my DC staffers and interns live in the District and most have been directly affected or know someone directly affected by the rampant crime. Our Nation’s Capital should be a shining city that everyone feels safe to live in and visit, and it can be that again!
https://t.co/xcAjZRMYea

I'm proud to ensure that Alabama's Fourth District gets a fair share of the money they send to Washington in federal taxes, and these projects are a clear example of that commitment in action. This investment will improve infrastructure, support local economies, and build a better future.
The economy is roaring back after shaking off the Biden malaise of the first quarter. The Trump economy is shifting into high gear.
I’m saddened to hear of the death of Annette Shelby, the wife of Senator Richard Shelby. She was always so kind and gracious. Caroline and I send our condolences and prayers to the Shelby family.

Great to meet with Dr. Mehmet Oz, Administrator for the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services, this morning to discuss opportunities that will benefit the people of Alabama’s 4th Congressional District. I remain committed to strengthening rural healthcare across our communities, while eliminating waste, fraud and abuse.
https://t.co/AgcFQWQiHx

What an honor to receive a birthday shoutout from @realDonaldTrump  In this video, he also gives a nod to my colleague Congresswoman Mary Miller Meeks as she celebrates her wedding anniversary — both on the same day!

Grateful for the kind words and proud to stand with President Trump for the America First agenda. #BirthdayShoutout #AmericaFirst #WeddingAnniversary #TrumpReel #TeamAderholt

I joined WKUL radio in Cullman to talk about how we’re honoring Vietnam Veterans this August with two recognition events. If you or someone you know served during the Vietnam era, I’d be honored to have you take part.

#VietnamVeterans #AL04 https://t.co/bbgAW7762g

Today I introduced the ARMS Act, aimed at investing in U.S. defense manufacturing, accelerating the delivery of critical defense equipment, and strengthening our national security. https://t.co/YI1RD1gN18
The One Big Beautiful Bill impacts Alabama by delivering the largest tax cut in history, higher wages, higher take-home pay, and much more. https://t.co/VkKFQMp2FU

I am proud to support @USRepGaryPalmer and co-sponsor the Securing America’s Mineral Supply (SAMS) Act. This legislation unleashes American energy and restores U.S. control over critical mineral production by codifying executive orders from President Trump.

https://t.co/x3sYStDtI0

Today, Caroline and I celebrated the 105th birthday of Mr. Roy Drinkard, the oldest living United States Marine and a pillar of the Cullman community.

To honor his life of service and commitment, I had a flag flown over the U.S. Capitol and a tribute entered into the Congressional Record. 

The Cullman Postmaster also presented him with a special set of U.S. Marine Corps stamps, a fitting tribute to a true American hero.

Happy Birthday Roy!

I’m in full support of @GovernorKayIvey and the State of Alabama deploying a search & rescue team to Texas following devastating flooding. Our brave first responders, including heroes from Tuscaloosa in the 4th District, are bringing much‑needed aid and hope to those affected. May God protect the rescue teams and all of those affected.
https://t.co/ROFwXctQ07

This August, I’ll be hosting two events to honor our Vietnam Era Veterans with a 50th Anniversary Commemorative Lapel Pinning Ceremony. If you are a Vietnam Veteran, who lives in the Fourth Congressional District, or know someone who is, and would like to take part — please visit this website: https://t.co/Ltd3rHL5ZX  or call 256-546-0201.

I’m sad to learn of the passing of Marshall County radio legend Bruce Underwood. He had been on the air on WTWX  in Guntersville since the 1950s, and while he had been off his regular morning radio program after a fall last year, he was still voicing commercials. Bruce was also the first Sand Mountain reporter for @whnt when they signed on in 1963   

I send my prayers to his family, his church family at Guntersville Church of Christ and his radio family who had listened to him for decades.

On this 4th of July, Caroline and I were honored to be at the White House for the signing of the One Big Beautiful Bill—by @realDonaldTrump blocking the largest tax hike in U.S. history, cutting taxes on tips/overtime, securing the border, and protecting Medicaid. 🇺🇸 #IndependenceDay
Happy Birthday America! https://t.co/aJgBRsZ08c via @YouTube

House just passed President Trump’s One Big Beautiful Bill — a big win for families, workers & the America First agenda.

Proud to lead on restoring the refundable Adoption Tax Credit.

More here ⬇️
https://t.co/Jn0NWKorup

#AmericaFirst #AL04 #ProLife #ProFamily https://t.co/rfAdxd8Jcp

The One Big Beautiful Bill delivers the America First agenda in a fiscally responsible way. Getting this bill to the President’s desk fulfills promises of an economy that is pro-growth, pro-family, pro-business, and pro-worker. It also continues to support the most vulnerable in our society while helping able-bodied individuals get back to work.

Big win for the Constitution.

Today’s SCOTUS decision rightly struck down the use of universal injunctions by lower courts. These broad rulings have too often undermined the will of elected leaders and ultimately their constituents.

The Court is restoring balance to the separation of powers.

For 65 years, the Marshall Space Flight Center has stood as a symbol of American ingenuity, exploration, and innovation. From the earliest days of the space race to today’s cutting-edge advancements, this center has played a vital role in our nation’s space story.
https://t.co/y5mjS46b8Q

Today is a win for parental rights. The Supreme Court’s decision in Mahmoud v Taylor reaffirms that respecting parental rights is not only lawful, but essential to preserving both parental rights and religious freedom. https://t.co/pvijBcQvCy
This is a win for life and a win for taxpayers. The American people should not have to fund partisan political organizations, like Planned Parenthood, that’s primary business is performing abortions.

I’m proud to support the Military Construction and Veteran Affairs Appropriations Act which strengthens our national defense, supports our service members and their families, and honors our commitment to America’s veterans. https://t.co/3ogxWHAs5J

Great meeting today with FBI Deputy Director Dan Bongino. We discussed moving more FBI assets to Redstone Arsenal in North Alabama. I think getting more of our national security infrastructure out of the DC area is a good thing. https://t.co/qMamG0Qs6s

Today marks the third anniversary of SCOTUS overturning Roe v. Wade in the Dobbs v. Jackson decision. I remain committed to fighting and advocating in Congress to expand our efforts and ensure a safe future for our nation's children—born and unborn. I pray for our nation and for lawmakers across the country to continue the fight to protect the lives of the unborn.

Today I met with the University of Alabama System’s Capitol Scholars to discuss my experience in Congress and the value of public service. 

It’s always inspiring to hear from students who are passionate about making a difference. https://t.co/M16iaxG7fA

Congratulations to President Trump for helping bring about a ceasefire between Israel and Iran. Iran’s nuclear program has been decimated without the loss of a single American. That is quite the accomplishment. I pray this will lead to lasting peace in the region. 🇺🇸

It sounds as if Iran might be ready for an off ramp. The strikes over the weekend ordered by President Trump and carried out by our great military I believe got their attention. I pray that is the case and they will finally give up their nuclear ambitions, but we must stay vigilant.

Iran’s decision to launch missiles at our forces in Qatar is not a smart move—but it’s also not surprising. Time and again, when given the chance to make the right choice, Iran has chosen the opposite. Their actions are driven by a deep-rooted hatred for America and Israel, not reason or diplomacy. I’m closely monitoring the situation for any reports of injury to our military personnel or assets.

There are crisis points in history when leaders must decide whether to take the Winston Churchill path or the Neville Chamberlain path. Tonight, President Trump has chosen the Churchill path, recognizing—just as Churchill did—that you cannot negotiate with a regime that continually calls for the destruction of Israel and America, just as it was impossible to negotiate with Nazi Germany.

I fully support President Trump’s decision to take out Iran’s nuclear facilities. As I have said, I believe that if Iran gets a functioning nuclear weapon they would not hesitate to use it against Israel or the United States. When they say death to Israel and death to America, we have no reason not to believe them. I pray this action has made the world safer. President Trump has pledged to get us out of “forever wars.” This could be a step toward ending the war we have been in with Iran since 1979. They have killed hundreds and hundreds of Americans in the past  half century.

📺 I joined @CBS_42 to discuss the ongoing conflict between Israel and Iran and what it means for U.S. national security and our allies in the region.

America must continue to stand strongly with Israel against threats from Iran.
https://t.co/950096rCKE

I am sad to hear of the passing of the new Marshall County Commission Chairman David Reed. He was just appointed to the office on June 9 after the death of Chairman Hutcheson. I send my prayers and condolences to the Reed family.

It’s always a privilege to see the talent from Alabama’s 4th District showcased in the U.S. Capitol. I had the pleasure of seeing Natalie Jones again this week—our Congressional Art Competition winner from Grant, AL. 

I first met Natalie in April at the district awards ceremony, and now her artwork, “Colors of Life,” is proudly hanging in the Capitol for the next year.

Israel has a right to defend itself from those who wish it harm and its extinction. And there is no greater threat to Israel than the prospect of a nuclear armed Iran. These strikes tonight come not because of Israel but because of the path Iran has chosen. Years of appeasement under President Biden has put the world at risk of nuclear escalation. If Iran is foolish enough to attack American services members or facilities, President Trump will no doubt respond in an overwhelming fashion. Please pray for Israel as they work to eliminate the Iranian threat.

Relocating the FBI’s National Academy from Quantico to Huntsville is an excellent decision by FBI leadership and President Trump. 

North Alabama has proven itself as a vital location for federal law enforcement and national security operations.

We remember. We honor.

By working together with President Trump and his administration, the House has produced a responsible spending plan that keeps our government open and functioning for the American people. Avoiding a shutdown is critical to ensuring our military is funded, our border is secured, and essential services remain operational. Moreover, President Trump’s leadership in calling for unity among Republicans was instrumental in guiding this process. While no plan is perfect, this proposal reflects a commitment to fiscal responsibility and conservative values while keeping our nation strong.
